syllabusName: Database Systems_Các hệ cơ sở dữ liệu
description:
- Knowledge about database systems has become an essential part of an education in computer science because database management has evolved from a specialized computer application to a central component of a modern computing environment.
- The content of this course includes aspects of database management basic concepts, database design, database languages, and database-system implementation. Basing on these contents, the course emphasizes on how to organize, maintain and retrieve efficiently data and information from a DBMS.
studentTasks: Students must attend at least 80% of contact slots in order to be accepted to the final examination.
Student is responsible to do all exercises given by instructor in class or at home and submit on time
Promptly access to the https://flm.fpt.edu.vn/ for up-to-date course information

materials.description: Database Management System (DBMS): A Practical Approach
materials.author: Rajiv Chopra

courseLearningOutcomes.name: CLO1
courseLearningOutcomes.details: Understand thedatabase concepts and database management system software

courseLearningOutcomes.name: CLO2
courseLearningOutcomes.details: Understand the relation model of data and Algebraic Query Language

courseLearningOutcomes.name: CLO3
courseLearningOutcomes.details: Understand data normalization and apply normalization techniques in database design

courseLearningOutcomes.name: CLO4
courseLearningOutcomes.details: Be able to model an application’s data requirements using conceptual modeling tools like ER diagrams and design database schemas based on the conceptual model.

courseLearningOutcomes.name: CLO5
courseLearningOutcomes.details: Be proficient in structure query language including Data Definition Language(DDL) and Data Manipulation Language(DML)

courseLearningOutcomes.name: CLO6
courseLearningOutcomes.details: Understand PL/SQL concepts and manipulate with View, Cursors, Stored Procedures, Functions, Database Triggers

courseLearningOutcomes.name: CLO7
courseLearningOutcomes.details: Apply the Index in database design and query optimization

constructiveQuestions.name: CQ1.1
constructiveQuestions.details: Why do we need database? How many stages of upgrade or development has the database gone through? Why did that happen? What is Database System?

constructiveQuestions.name: CQ1.2
constructiveQuestions.details: What is a Database System and the role of Database Systems? What is a Database Management System? What and how can programmers do with the database?

constructiveQuestions.name: CQ1.3
constructiveQuestions.details: What is Data Model? What belong to a Data Model?How can we describe and give some examples of the Relations, Attributes, Tuples, Domains?

constructiveQuestions.name: CQ2.1
constructiveQuestions.details: What are Relation instances, Schema, DB schema. How can we use SQL to define relation schemas?

constructiveQuestions.name: CQ2.2
constructiveQuestions.details: What is an Algebra? What is Relational Algebra? Why do we need Algebraic Query Language?

constructiveQuestions.name: CQ2.3
constructiveQuestions.details: What are usecases of Relational Algebra Operations?

constructiveQuestions.name: CQ3.1
constructiveQuestions.details: What are constraints on Relations?

constructiveQuestions.name: CQ3.2
constructiveQuestions.details: How can we express constrains by relational algebra?

constructiveQuestions.name: CQ3.3
constructiveQuestions.details: How can we use relational algebra to define constrains in some database?

constructiveQuestions.name: CQ5.1
constructiveQuestions.details: What are Functional Dependencies? Why you need rules about Functional Dependencies? What is usecase of each rule?

constructiveQuestions.name: CQ5.2
constructiveQuestions.details: What are keys, super-keys, closure-sets, closing sets of FD’s and how to determine them?

constructiveQuestions.name: CQ5.3
constructiveQuestions.details: What are Anomalies? Can we solve Anomalies? How to solve?

constructiveQuestions.name: CQ6.1
constructiveQuestions.details: Why should we decompose a relation?

constructiveQuestions.name: CQ6.2
constructiveQuestions.details: What is a simple way to normalize schema to 1NF, 2NF, 3NF, BCNF? Please, give some examples.

constructiveQuestions.name: CQ6.3
constructiveQuestions.details: What are the good, bad and ugly of decomposition?

constructiveQuestions.name: CQ8.1
constructiveQuestions.details: What is Database model? How can we describe the Database Design Process?

constructiveQuestions.name: CQ8.2
constructiveQuestions.details: How many Level Database Model? What are they?

constructiveQuestions.name: CQ8.3
constructiveQuestions.details: Why do we use Conceptual Design (or Logical Design)?

constructiveQuestions.name: CQ9.1
constructiveQuestions.details: What are Entity, Entity Set, Entity Instances, Attributes and others in ERD?

constructiveQuestions.name: CQ9.2
constructiveQuestions.details: What is a relationship and how to realize it? How can we draw an ERD?

constructiveQuestions.name: CQ9.3
constructiveQuestions.details: Are there any principles or constraints in designing ERDs?

constructiveQuestions.name: CQ12.1
constructiveQuestions.details: How can we use simple queries in some examples?

constructiveQuestions.name: CQ12.2
constructiveQuestions.details: How can we query data involving more than one relation? Please, give some examples.

constructiveQuestions.name: CQ12.3
constructiveQuestions.details: What are subqueries? Can you apply them im some examples?

constructiveQuestions.name: CQ13.1
constructiveQuestions.details: How can we use grouping and aggregate functions? Please, give some examples.

constructiveQuestions.name: CQ13.2
constructiveQuestions.details: What is HAVING clause? When should we use grouping and aggregate functions with HAVING clauses? Why?

constructiveQuestions.name: CQ13.3
constructiveQuestions.details: What are DDL, DML? How can we describe INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE queries? Please, give some examples.

constructiveQuestions.name: CQ16.1
constructiveQuestions.details: How can we use SQL to create/modify constraints of a relation?

constructiveQuestions.name: CQ16.2
constructiveQuestions.details: What is a trigger? Why do we use triggers?

constructiveQuestions.name: CQ16.3
constructiveQuestions.details: How many components in a trigger? How to create a trigger?

assessments.questionType: Multiple choices; Marked by Computer or a suitable format
assessments.note:
Instruction and schedules for Progress Tests must be presented in the Course Implementation Plan approved by director of the campus.
Progress test must be taken right after the last lectures of required material.
Instructor has responsibility to review the test for students after graded.
The exam questions must be updated or different at least 70% to the previous ones.
